paper_abstract: We have carried out comparative study between direct N-body technique and Fokker-Planck approach for the dynamical evolution of rotating stellar systems. Because of limitations of computing resources, we have restricted to relatively small N (similar to 10,000) systems compared to realistic star clusters. We found that these two different approaches generally give very similar results. Some minor differences are found to exist, but they can be understood because Fokker-Planck approach has to make some simplifying assumptions. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Dynamical evolution of rotating stellar systems: Fokker-Planck and N-body
